inscription: LLC, in pencil: BARE ARMS (THE PRACTICE 2) | bottom center, in pencil: AP | LRC, in pencil: #12
markings: printed biography of artist, taped to frame on back
provenance: The artist, Cleveland; [Thomas French Fine Art, Fairlawn, Ohio]; given to MIA, 2019.
text:
What are these young men up to now?! This is a loving portrait of the artist’s oh so human son. What parent of boys cannot relate to the testing of budding manhood? 

This drypoint is part of a suite of images created for an exhibition at Spaces, Cleveland, on the theme “The Second Amendment: The Black Panther Party.” The title, Bare Arms, is a gentle act of resistance against America’s extraordinarily permissive attitude toward guns and the concomitant violence.
title: Bare Arms (The Practice #2)
